ratings.comment: Sesil is awesome and I would definitely take him for MHR 300. This class is so easy its almost a guaranteed A. He's honestly a really nice guy and kind of hilarious. Your grade is mainly just group projects which are super easy and quizzes which are all open note. Don't have to read the textbook or take any notes. Would def take again with him.

Professor Sesil is a great professor. He is incredibly smart and very well versed in the world of business. He is very kind to students and wants them to succeed. I would definitely take another class with him as he is great at what he does. MHR 300 is pretty much based around group projects, so it is something to consider if you take this class.

Favorite class this semester. I love this little guy! Take the class in person. He would give us candy and chocolates for the holidays too. Classes were fun group activities. No stress. He pushed back the due dates weeks back to accommodate us. He was such a nice guy. Definitely recommend.

This class was asynch and done entirely through the textbook. He posted supplementary lectures but it was basically learning everything through the textbook platform, which I personally hate. Class was interesting enough I guess if you like psychology you'll find some things interesting.

Sesil is first off, hilarious, and second, he is so caring about his students. He truly listens to everyone's concerns and will accommodate everyone's needs to make sure we can get things done effectively & without an overload of stress. Take a class in person with him because he makes class fun. Exams are content heavy & lots of textbook material.

Sesil will be the most caring professor you'll ever have. He's pushed back so many due dates so that students could focus on their other midterms and projects. Although I'm online with him, take an in-person class with him if you ever get the chance to! He truly cares about his students and reads through ALL of the best self paper.

I'm not sure about the rest of these reviews, but Sesil is very caring and more forgiving than he should be for assignment and it's very appreciated. It's very easy, busy work, but skimming the text weekly was enough to get an A. Make sure to do the homework & start your group project and Best Self paper early. Definitely take this class with him!!

I think this prof realized his terrible ratings and overcorrected this semester online! He was the most understanding, lax, caring prof I've ever had. Pushed back almost every deadline without request, had no lectures, and the assignments were all mostly busywork. Lots of textbook reading and notes, but exams were open-note so they were easy.

Super easy class with Prof. Sesil. I have heard horror stories of students getting awful grades in such an easy class like MHR 300 due to the competitive curve. With Prof. Sesil, I spent less than an hour or two each week TOTAL, including lecture, readings, quizzes, and modules. Would recommend taking for an easy A.

I don't think he wants to teach this class at all. It's honestly so useless and he knows it. You can look up the answers to each quiz on quizlet, and the tests aren't bad at all (given that you know basic business concepts). It's really just a class where you need to memorize some vocab. Overall, the class is futile but he's fine.

Seems like a nice guy, but it is evident from the first minute of class he could care less about the course. He is only teaching it because he is required to do so in order to do the research he does (of which he talks about constantly). Overall a useless course, but if you want to get something out of it try and take with someone else.
The class lacked interesting and useful topics, but James was still enthusiastic about the topics and real world application.

MHR 300 as a class is just awful. The class itself is just straight memorization, so not hard, it's just really useless information. Sesil seemed like a really nice guy, just a little dry. He was really relaxed and in all honesty, seems like the best bet for an extremely boring class. Just read the book and do Quizlets and you should be fine.

All the lectures are online and are terrible - the textbook is key for this class. Sesil is one of the people who does the in-person discussion sections. I would recommend taking him because he was a really nice guy who cared about us all doing well. MHR300 sucks as a class but since you have to take it, take it with him
This class is pretty easy with most of it being online. You just have to be self-motivated. Professor Sesil really tries to expand and apply what you learned. I think he is a great professor.

Sesil tries hard to be nice, which ends up being awful. Grades are really high through the semester, and then curved harshly, so that you mostly end up graded on random error--you have to work really, really hard to ensure an A. Papers are graded by TA. Exams are MCQs and essays; essay topics are easy to predict. Long, online lectures aren't great.
